page.title: 01DEEPING ST JAMES
page.content: Deeping St. James is a very old village.It is mentioned in the Domesday book as Estdepinge. The river Welland runs though part of our block separating Lincolnshire from Cambridge -shire.There are a lot of new housing estates and a few old stone houses some of which have been converted in to modern homes. Our block includes only a small part of the residential area of the village, most of our block is farm- land.Many of the people who live in this village go to work in Peterboro- gh which is only about 10 miles away. The countryside around is very flat and is mostly arable farm land. There are four main farms.The oldest church is the Priory church. On the top of the Priory church is a cockerel which can be seen for miles around.
